metadata.title: CVE-2017-16545 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The ReadWPGImage function in coders/wpg.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 does notproperly validate colormapped images, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (ImportIndexQuantumType invalid write andapplication crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via amalformed WPG image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-18
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-18
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-18
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-18
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-18
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-18').
